places_with_reviews.name: Sardar Vallabhbhai Patel Museum
places_with_reviews.address: Bhuvneshwari Nagar Society, Bardoli, Gujarat 394601, India

reviews.text: If you want to know about the life of Sardar Patel and his role in the struggle movements then this museum is worth visiting once in a lifetime. This museum is a part of his official residence and there is a lot to see and recognize the significance of. It is housed in a large comfy air-conditioned building and is open every day from 9 am to 5 pm except Wednesdays and government holidays, where Indian citizens can visit for an entry ticket of one rupee without any crowd. Staff is very polite and supportive. It is positioned at a distance of 30 km from Surat and at a walk-able distance from Bardoli railway station as well as the bus station. If you want, you can hire an auto at the rate of Rs 20.

Indeed, the statue and museum dedicated to Sardar Vallabhai Patel serve as a powerful tribute to his remarkable leadership and enduring legacy as the "Iron Man of India." His instrumental role in unifying the nation and his pragmatic leadership style continue to inspire and influence India's history and future.

Very good place to visit. Unfortunately upper floors were closed during our visit. Photography is strictly prohibited inside. In some portion of museum staffs are available to tell about the museum which was really good.

The Iron Man of India, Sardar Vallabhbhai Patel is born in Bardoli. He got fame from his Bardoli Satyagrah. He was the architect of the Modern India. He combined 535 princly states into one nation. The Museum is a tribute to him. The place is peaceful like expected. Various statues, a lot of photographs ate collected here to see and learn about Sardar Vallabhbhai Patel's life. Place needs more maintenance and funds so the management can redecorate the museum.
Photography is strictly prohibited inside the museum.
A good stop for History Lovers and adventure lovers.
Nice place with original photos.
